question: Question_01_(b)
statement:
Evaluate $\int_0^\pi \left| \cos x\right|\,dx.$ You must simplify your
answer \emph{completely}.
sols:
$\int_0^\pi |\cos{x}|dx=\int_0^{\pi/2} |\cos{x}|dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi |\cos{x}|dx$

Remember that cos is positive on $[0,\pi/2]$ and negative on
$[\pi/2,\pi]$ so

\begin{align*}
\int_0^{\pi/2} |\cos{x}|dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi |\cos{x}|dx&=\int_0^{\pi/2}\cos{x}dx+\int_{\pi/2}^\pi -\cos{x}dx\\
&=\sin(x)|_0^{\pi/2}-\sin(x)|_{\pi/2}^{\pi}\\
&=\sin(\pi/2)-\sin{(0)}-(\sin(\pi)-\sin(\pi/2))\\
&=1-0-(0-1)=2
\end{align*}
hints: On what range is $\cos(x)$ positive and negative?
